column1: It is our duty now to begin to lay the plans and determine the strategy for the winning of a lasting peace and the establishment of an American standard of living higher than ever before known. We cannot be content
column2: no matter how high that general standard of living may be
column3: if some fraction of our people — whether it be one-third or one-fifth or one-tenth — is ill-fed
column6: and insecure.This Republic had its beginning
column7: and grew to its present strength
column8: under the protection of certain inalienable political rights — among them the right of free speech
column12: freedom from unreasonable searches and seizures. They were our rights to life and liberty.As our nation has grown in size and stature
column13: however — as our industrial economy expanded — these political rights proved inadequate to assure us equality in the pursuit of happiness.We have come to a clear realization of the fact that true individual freedom cannot exist without economic security and independence. "Necessitous men are not free men." People who are hungry and out of a job are the stuff of which dictatorships are made.
